12240,"Sign up via email & password","No","","2024-02-13T02:49:32.400Z","Andrew Kwok","","","","Signup","","ROUT-9227,ROUT-9228","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Signup Rejection for Improperly Formatted Email Address
Given the user is on the signup page
When the user enters ""<invalidEmail>"" as the email address
Then the form cannot be submitted
And a message about the improper email format should be displayed
Examples:
| invalidEmail        |
| plaintext           |
| @no-user.com        |
| user@.com.my        |
| user.name@domain    |
| user#@domain.co.in  |
| user@domain..com |
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Rejecting Signup with Duplicate Email
Given the user is on the signup page
When the user attempts to signup with an email that already has an account
And submits the signup form
Then the signup should be rejected
And a message to contact support should be displayed
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Viewing Terms of Service during Signup
Given the user is on the signup page
When the user clicks on the Terms of Service link
Then the Terms of Service are displayed
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Switching to Login from the Signup Flow
Given the user is on the signup page
When the user clicks on the login link
Then the login page should be displayed
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Signup with Weak Password Rejection
Given the user has successfully validated the email
And is now setting name and password
When the user enters a weak password
Then the signup form cannot be submitted
And a message about password requirements should be displayed","Active","Passed","2025-12-19T21:21:14.573Z","","","","BDD Feature","2026-01-21T16:56:15.448Z","Jenya Farris"

column1: 1532872,"Verify email ownership","No","","2025-09-05T14:54:21.173Z","Jamil","","","","Signup","","","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Successful email verification

column2: Given user submits a valid email address to sign up with
And  receives a verification code
When the user submits the correct verification code within its validity window
Then the user can proceed to setting User Name and Password
And gain access to the product afterwards

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User enters an incorrect verification code

column2: Given the verification code is invalid
When the user submits the code
Then the system rejects the attempt
And gives user feedback about the failed attempt

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Contact support if verification fails

column2: Given the submitted code was expired or invalid
And the verification fails
Then the user can contact support directly from the failure feedback

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Verification code expires

column2: Given the validity period of the code has passed
When the user submits that code
Then the system rejects the code
And gives user feedback about the failed attempt

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Resend Verification Code

column2: Given the user has already received a verification code during signup
And there is no ongoing cooldown period
When the user requests a new verification code
Then a new verification code is generated and sent to the user
And all previously issued codes are invalidated
And the user is shown feedback indicating the remaining cooldown time

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Request new verification code during cooldown period

column2: Given the user has requested a new verification code
When the user attempts to request another code before the cooldown completes
Then the user is not allowed to request another code A

53242,"User is redirected by the system to the applicable view","No","","2024-02-20T17:35:24.095Z","Nina","","","","Authentication","","","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Default to last viewed workspace and date
Given a user has viewed routes on a specific date
And has closed the application
When the user visits the application without specifying a path
Then the user is taken to their last viewed workspace and last viewed date
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Fallback to oldest workspace and today's date
Given a user is logged in and their oldest workspace has no routes
And the user has no last viewed workspace or date
When the user visits the application without specifying a URL
Then the user is redirected to their oldest workspace on today's date
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Logged in user with no specified workspace or date
Given a user is logged in and their oldest workspace has routes scheduled
And the user has no last viewed workspace or date
When the user visits the application without specifying a URL
Then the user is redirected to their oldest workspace on the latest date with routes
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User in a workspace with no stored last viewed date
Given the user has no stored last viewed date
When a user logs into a specific workspace
Then the system falls back to the most recent date with routes in that workspace
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: No routes available on any date
Given a user is logged in and in a specific workspace
And there are no routes available on any date for the user's workspace
When the system determines the routing
Then the user is redirected to the default routing view on today's date
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Navigating to an exact workspace, date, and view via URL
Given a user is logged in
When the user navigates to an exact workspace, date, and view via URL
Then the application takes the user to that exact workspace, date, and view","Active","Passed","2025-07-28T19:44:30.360Z","","","","BDD Feature","2025-11-20T17:40:47.020Z","Teja Vajha"

column1: 41,"Previous mapping is applied when no new fields are detected","No","","2024-01-31T03:06:04.959Z","Andrew Kwok","","","","Mapping uploaded data","","ROUT-9312","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Skip mapping when a file is recognized

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Multiple columns match a mapped field
Given a user has an order file format with two ""Customer Address"" fields
And they have mapped one of those columns to Routic's ""Address"" field
When the user uploads an order file with the same format
// Same format is defined by the column headers names and sequence being identical
Then their column mapping should be remembered
And they are not asked to map their data again
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Mapped columns are remembered when column sequence changes
Given a user has an order file format with ""Customer Address""
And ""Customer Address"" is the first column in their file format
And has mapped ""Customer Address"" to Routific's ""Address"" field
When the user changes the ""Customer Address"" to be the second column in their file format
And uploads the order file
Then ""Customer Address"" should be remembered as mapped to ""Address""
And they should not be asked to map their data again.
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Remember overrides of default mappings
Given a user has an order file format containing ""Customer Address"" and ""Address"" columns
And they have previously mapped ""Customer Address"" to Routific's ""Address"" field
When they upload the same file format again
Then ""Customer Address"" should be remembered as mapped to ""Address""
And they should not be asked to map their data again.","Active","Passed","2025-07-14T19:45:17.793Z","","","","BDD Feature","2025-11-21T20:19:34.792Z","Teja Vajha"

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block""> Scenario: Date format auto detection fails and falls back to browser locale

<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block""> Scenario: Routific retries failed validations against other supported formats

column1: 461803,"User can edit order coordinates","No","","2024-07-24T20:09:47.307Z","Teja Vajha","","","","Editing Orders","","ROUT-10985","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User cannot save invalid lat/lng coordinates

column2: When a user opens the order modal in either create or edit state
And inputs an invalid lat/lng
Then the user should be blocked from saving the order
And the user is presented with an error state that shows what a proper lat/lng format looks like

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can manually set the location of the order by specifying coordinates

column2: When user opens the order modal to create a new order
And only enters a valid set of coordinates for the order
Then the user is unblocked from saving the order
And the value in the address text field should be unchanged

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can add text in the address field to be used as a label for chosen coordinates

column2: Given the update order modal is open for an existing order with a successfully geocoded address
When an user updates the address text field under the precise location tab
Then the address is not subsequently geocoded with the coordinates unchanged
And the user is allowed the save the changes

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Switching from use address tab to use precise location should preserve the location details

column2: When a user enters an address in the ""use address"" tab
And makes a selection from the dropdown list
And switches to the ""use address"" tab
Then both the coordinates for the geocoded address and the address string for the order are preserved

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Switching to use address tab from use precise location should clear location details

column2: When a user enters coordinates and address information in the ""use coordinates"" tab
And switches to the ""use address"" tab
Then the address information is not carried over from the ""use coordinates"" tab

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Updating the pin location should automatically switch to use precise location tab

column2: Given a user has order modal open with use address tab selected
When a user selects the location for the order using the pin location on map feature
Then the order modal should show the location of the order on the map
And the user should be presented with the coordinates information under the ""use precise location"" tab

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Order modal renders ""use address"" tab if the uploaded order via csv was using address only

column2: Given a user has uploaded orders via csv using only address string information
And an order exists that has been successfully geocoded
When the user opens the order modal for this existing order
Then the user is presented with geocoded address string under the ""use address"" tab

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Order modal renders ""use precise location"" tab if the uploaded order via csv using lat/lng information

column2: Given a user has uploaded orders via csv using both address string and lat/lng information
When the user opens the order modal for one these successfully located orders
Then the user is presented with the uploaded coordinates and address string under the ""use precise location"" tab

column1: 888,"Assign single order to specific route","No","","2024-02-01T06:46:47.934Z","Andrew Kwok","","","","Scheduling orders to routes","","ROUT-9090","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Assign an order to an empty route
Given a route exists with no orders scheduled to it
When a user selects an order
And chooses that route to schedule it to
Then the order is scheduled to the route
And usage is increased for that order as long as it has never been scheduled before
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">  Scenario: Schedule a single order to existing route
Given there is exactly 1 unscheduled order to be scheduled
When the user attempts to schedule it to an existing route with orders
Then Routific schedules the order into the route without changing the existing sequence
And usage is increased for that order as long as it has never been scheduled before
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Scheduling less than 10% of orders into existing route

column2: Given there are unscheduled orders to be scheduled
And the ratio of unscheduled orders to all scheduled orders is less than 10%
When the user schedules the new orders to an existing route/s
Then Routific schedules the orders into routes without changing the existing sequence

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Scheduling more than 10% of orders into existing route

column2: Given there are unscheduled orders to be scheduled
And the ratio of unscheduled orders to all scheduled orders is more than 10%
When the user schedules the new orders to an existing route
Then the user has an option to choose between inserting the orders without re-optimizing existing route
Or scheduling the new orders by re-optimizing the existing route

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Unable to assign an order currently being scheduled
Given an order is currently being scheduled to a route on a day
When a user selects the same order
Then the user cannot schedule it
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Cannot schedule an order to a completed route
Given the user has a completed route
When a user selects an order
Then the user cannot choose a completed route to schedule the order
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Schedule an order with an overnight time window
Given there is an order with a time window where the start time is before midnight, and the end time is after midnight
And there is a route which can accommodate that order at any time during its time window
When a user selects that order
And chooses that route to schedule it to
Then the order is scheduled to the route
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Loading state and optimization notification
When a user chooses to schedule order/s to a specific route
And a scheduling action is triggered
Then the user is notified via a visual affordance that an active optimization is in-progress

And a success or failure notification is presented to user at the end of the scheduling action.","Active","Passed","2026-01-15T17:16:23.749Z","","","","BDD Feature","2026-01-21T21:03:05.376Z","Teja Vajha"

122874,"Free plan users have limits to scheduling","No","","2024-03-20T19:57:01.379Z","Jenya Farris","","","","Scheduling orders to routes","","ROUT-9092","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Block scheduling when it would exceed monthly orders limit
Given a company is on the free plan
And a user has some orders which have never been scheduled
And the number of those orders exceeds the remaining free order limit
When they attempt to schedule those orders to a day
Then they are blocked from scheduling
And they can initiate an upgrade flow or contact sales
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Block order scheduling when monthly limit is reached
Given a company is on the free plan
And 100 orders have already been scheduled this billing period

Then they are blocked from scheduling
And they can initiate an upgrade flow or contact sales
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Block scheduling to selected route when it would exceed monthly orders limit
Given a company is on the free plan
And a user has selected some orders which have never been scheduled
And the number of those orders exceeds the remaining free order limit
When they attempt to assign those orders to a route
Then they are blocked from scheduling
And they can initiate an upgrade flow or contact sales
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Block scheduling when it would exceed monthly orders limit
Given a company is on the free plan
And a user has lassoed some orders which have never been scheduled
And the number of those orders exceeds the remaining free order limit
When they attempt to drop those orders to schedule them to a route
Then they are blocked from scheduling
And they can initiate an upgrade flow or contact sales","Draft","Retest","2025-12-04T19:59:15.099Z","","","","BDD Feature","2024-03-20T19:58:46.484Z","Jenya Farris"

648101,"Routific can determine the optimal start time for the route","No","","2024-09-20T17:50:44.244Z","Teja Vajha","","","","Scheduling orders to routes","","","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User enables flexible start time option without time windows

column2: Given that none of the orders have a time-window constraint
And routes have start time assigned
And flexible start time option is enabled
When user schedules orders to routes
Then all routes begin at the start time specified on the route

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User enables flexible start time option with time windows

column2: Given that all orders have a time-window constraint
And flexible start time option is enabled
When user schedules orders to routes
Then all the routes begin at the most optimal time based on the time windows of the orders that minimizes any idle time in the route

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User enables flexible start time option with time of day predicted traffic

column2: Given that orders may or may not have a time-window constraint
And flexible start time option is enabled
When user schedules orders to routes with time of day predicted traffic option

Then routes optimal start time is determined based on time of day predicted traffic conditions ","Draft","Passed","2025-12-04T17:15:08.205Z","","","","BDD Feature","2024-09-20T18:08:12.254Z","Teja Vajha"

column1: 1674139,"User can schedule subset of orders into mix of published routes","No","","2025-11-20T23:27:55.857Z","Marc","","","","Scheduling orders to routes","","","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Schedule single order to a single published route
Given any non-completed order and a published route
When a user selects the order
And chooses to schedule it
Then the user has the option to select a published route
And the order will be best-inserted
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Schedule multiple orders to a single published route
Given a selection of non-completed orders and a published route
When a user chooses to schedule them
Then the user has the option to select a published route
And the orders will be best-inserted
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Schedule single order to a mix of published and unpublished routes
Given any non-completed order and a mix of published and unpublished routes
When a user selects the order
And chooses to schedule it
Then the user has the option to select a mix of published and unpublished routes
And the order will be best-inserted into the subset of selected routes
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Schedule multiple orders to a mix of published and unpublished routes
Given a selection of non-completed orders and a mix of published and unpublished routes
When a user chooses to schedule them
Then the user has the option to select a mix of published and unpublished routes
And the orders will be best-inserted into the subset of selected routes
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Schedule All with a mix of published and unpublished routes
Given some unscheduled and a mix of published and unpublished routes
When a user chooses to ""schedule all"" or ""plan routes""
Then the user has no option to select a subset of routes
When the user proceeds with scheduling
Then the orders will only be scheduled to unpublished routes.","Draft","Passed","2026-01-07T18:39:51.576Z","","","","BDD Feature","2025-11-21T18:51:49.491Z","Marc"

1684376,"User can schedule mix of scheduled and unscheduled orders into multiple routes","No","","2025-11-25T22:35:24.095Z","Marc","","","","Scheduling orders to routes","","","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Schedule mix of scheduled and unscheduled to multiple routes
Given scheduled routes and some unscheduled orders
When a user selects the unscheduled together with orders that were scheduled
And chooses to schedule it
Then the user has the option to select multiple routes to schedule it into
And all selected orders will be scheduled to those routes

<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Schedule mix of scheduled and unscheduled to multiple routes, while leaving already scheduled orders alone in the target routes
Given scheduled routes and some unscheduled orders
When a user selects the unscheduled together with orders that were scheduled
And chooses to schedule it
And the user selects a target route that includes a selected scheduled order
Then the scheduling action will leave the selected order where it was
And schedule the rest
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Schedule scheduled order to multiple routes
Given a schedule order and multiple routes
When a user selects the scheduled
And chooses to reschedule it from the ODP
Then the user has the option to select multiple routes to schedule it into
And the order will be scheduled to one of those routes","Draft","Passed","2025-12-05T17:58:26.252Z","","","","BDD Feature","2025-11-25T22:40:47.571Z","Marc"

928,"Resolving route conflicts between dispatcher and driver","No","","2024-02-02T07:07:59.134Z","Andrew Kwok","","","","Modifying Schedule for Live Routes","","","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Driver's completion of a stop overrides dispatcher's removal of the same stop
Given the dispatcher is making changes to a driver's route
And the driver is actively completing stops on the route
When the dispatcher removes a stop from the route
And the driver completes the same stop before the driver receives that change
Then the system should record the stop as completed
And maintain the stop on the driver's route despite removal by the dispatcher
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Dispatcher's reassignment of a stop overridden by driver's completion
Given the dispatcher is making changes to a driver's route
And the driver is actively completing stops on that route
When the dispatcher moves a stop to a different route
And the driver completes that stop before the driver receives that change
Then the system should record the stop as completed on the original driver's route
And disregard the dispatcher's reassignment of the stop
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Dispatcher's optimization action overridden by driver's completion of a stop
Given the dispatcher is making changes to a driver's route
And the driver is actively completing stops on that route
When the dispatcher unschedules a stop from the driver's route
And starts an optimization with the unscheduled stop
And the driver completes that stop before they receive the changes to their route
Then the system should record the stop as completed on the driver's route
And disregard the dispatcher's optimization action on the stop

column1: 1547202,"User can manage overtime perference","No","","2025-09-11T21:23:10.007Z","Teja Vajha","","","","Optimization Preferences","","","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Successfully schedule orders with relaxed overtime preference

column2: Given the dispatcher has existing routes with or without overtime violations
And the overtime constraint is set to relaxed
When the dispatcher attempts to schedule new orders
Then Routific should schedule all orders into existing routes
And notify the dispatcher that all orders were successfully scheduled

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Successfully schedule orders with strict overtime preference

column2: Given the dispatcher has existing routes with or without overtime violations
And the overtime constraint is set to strict
When the dispatcher attempts to schedule new orders
Then Routific should schedule as many orders as possible into existing routes without worsening any existing overtime violations
And notify the dispatcher how many orders were successfully scheduled

column1: 1835095,"Return default solver solution when GPU solver is unavailable","No","","2026-01-21T22:44:46.905Z","Teja Vajha","","","","Failure Handling","","","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: (Only on dev + staging) Return LS solution to the user when GPU worker unavailable
Given there are no GA workers provisioned
And the organization is opted into competing solver architecture
When the dispatcher triggers a scheduling action that generally completes within 1 min

Then Routific returns the LS solution given that the GA worker is unavailable

Note:

  • This scenario can only be tested in dev and stg because these environments have underprovisioned GPU workers meaning they get spun up on-demand, which takes roughly 2-3 mins. This means that for a small enough problem LS solution is returned because the GA worker doesn't get spun up on time, which mimic ga worker unavailability case.
  • On Prod, there's always bound to be a GA worker provisioned 24/7 so this test cannot be executed consistently in a predictive manner.
  • stg url to check if GA worker is available.
","Draft","Passed","2026-01-22T00:10:42.187Z","","","","BDD Feature","2026-01-21T22:46:27.409Z","Teja Vajha"

487,"User can add a route from scheduling preview","No","","2024-01-31T03:06:08.876Z","Andrew Kwok","<ul>
• (applies to all)
• From the orders tray, click schedule and open the scheduling modal
• click Add Route button
• add new route name, select start and end times, click Create Route
• Create Route Form should open
• Once new route is successfully added, we get a success notification that describes the route name
• After a success notification, we should see the newly added routes in the route table
• Added routes should show empty utilization gauges
• Route should have unique colour (as long as routes.length is < 50)
1.After adding new route, route renders in route table
1.Once route is added, ‘Automatically create routes’ value should change to ‘no’
2.After adding new route, route renders in route table, should be in alphabetical order
3.After adding new route, constraint violation warning still visible
3.After adding new route, route renders in route table, should be in alphabetical order
3.Once route is added, ‘Automatically creates route’ value should still say ‘no’
4.expected outcomes the same as number 3
4.After adding new route, route renders in route table, active routes should be in alphabetical order, dispatched routes should be disabled and render under active routes
5.expected outcomes the same as number 3

5.After adding new route, route renders in route table as the only active route, dispatched routes should be disabled and render under active route

1698706,"User can duplicate one or more routes","No","","2025-11-26T05:16:20.773Z","Jamil","","","","Adding Routes","","","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Duplicate one or more non-empty routes
Given the user has selected one or more non-empty routes ( upto 10)
When they choose to duplicate them
And confirm a selected date
Then they get replicas of the active version of the routes placed on the selected date
And all the stops, sequence, order metadata and ETAs on the replicas are the same as the originals
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Duplicate one or more empty routes
Given the user has selected one or more empty routes (upto 10)
When they choose to duplicate them
And confirm a selected date
Then they get replicas of the empty routes placed on the selected date
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Duplicate one or more routes with unpublished changes
Given the user has selected one or more routes with unpublished changes (upto 10)
When they choose to duplicate them
And confirm a selected date
Then they get replicas of the active version of the routes including the unpublished changes placed on the selected date
And all the stops, sequence, order metadata and ETAs on the replicas are the same as the originals
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Duplicate multiple routes in a single action
Given the user has selected multiple routes (upto 10)
When they choose to duplicate them
And confirm a selected date
Then they get replicas of all the selected routes placed on the selected date
And all the stops, sequence, order metadata and ETAs on the replicas are the same as the originals
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Prevent duplicating more than 10 routes at once
Given the user has selected more than 10 routes
When they choose to duplicate them
Then the duplication request fails
And the user is informed that more than 10 routes cannot be duplicated at once

When the user presses the stop marker toggle button
Then the user sees the scatterplot icons for their orders on their routes
When the user refreshes their browser
Then they continue to see scatterplot icons on their routes

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User selects a route with stop markers toggled off

column2: Given the user has at least one route scheduled
When the user selects a scheduled route
Then the user can see stop markers above the stops in that route
And all other routes continue to have scatterplot icons
When the user deselects the selected route
Then all routes have scatterplot icons

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User selects a route with stop markers toggled on

column2: Given the user has at least one route scheduled
When the user selects a scheduled route
Then the user can see stop markers above the stops in that route
And all other routes continue to have stop marker icons
When the user deselects the selected route
Then all routes have stop marker icons

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User toggles marker icons on while a route is selected

column2: Given the user has at least one route scheduled
And stop markers are turned off
When the user selects a scheduled route
Then the user can see stop markers above the stops in that route
And all other routes continue to have scatterplot icons
When the user presses the marker toggle button
Then the selected route stays selected
And all routes have stop marker icons

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User toggles marker icons off while a route is selected

column2: Given the user has at least one route scheduled
And stop markers are turned on
When the user selects a scheduled route
Then the user can see stop markers above the stops in that route
And all other routes continue to have stop marker icons
When the user presses the marker toggle button
Then the selected route stays selected
And all unselected routes have scatterplot icons

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User uses lasso tool while stop markers are turned on

column2: Given the user has at least one route scheduled
And stop markers are turned on
When the user activates the lasso tool
Then the stop marker icons are toggled off while the tool is active
When the user deactivates the lasso tool
Then the stop markers reappear

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User drags and drops a stop while stop markers are turned on

column2: Given the user has at least one route scheduled
And stop markers are turned on
When the user tries to drag and drop a stop to another route
Then the stop marker icons are toggled off while the user is dragging the stop
When the user stops dragging the stop
Then the stop markers reappear","Draft","Passed","2025-07-15T04:19:25.071Z","","","","BDD Feature","2024-10-24T18:25:26.974Z","Brian"

column1: 864262,"Map pans and zooms to show routes","No","","2024-11-28T14:44:42.070Z","Jenya Farris","","","","Viewing Routes on Map","","","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Show all routes on the map from the calendar view
Given routes exist on this day
When the user navigates into the day from the calendar view
Then the map will show all routes on that day within view, including stops, start, and end locations
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Maps pans when selecting a route from the timeline or list view
Given routes exist on this day
When the user selects a route from the timeline or list view
Then the route will go into its selected state
And the RDP opens
And the map will center on the selected route and zoom out to fit the route if any stops or start/end locations are out of view
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Map does not pan or zoom when selecting a route from the map
Given routes exist on this day
When the user selects a route from the map
Then the route will go into its selected state
And the RDP will open
And the map will not pan or zoom
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Maps pans to show multiselected routes
Given routes exist on this day
When the user multiselects 2+ routes from the timeline or list view
Then the routes will go into a selected state
And the RDP will remain closed
And the map will center on the selected routes
And the map will zoom out to fit all routes if out of view
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Map does not pan or zoom when multi-selecting routes from the map
Given routes exist on this day
When the user multiselects 2+ routes from the map
Then the routes will go into a selected state
And the RDP will remain closed
And the map will not pan or zoom","Draft","Passed","2025-07-15T04:19:25.071Z","","","","BDD Feature","2024-11-28T14:53:44.756Z","Jenya Farris"

133115,"User can edit route","No","","2024-03-26T21:48:33.107Z","Andrew Kwok","","","","Modifying Routes","","ROUT-9853","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Update route name

column2: Given a user has a non-published route
When the user updates the route name
Then the name should be updated

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Update route start or end location

column2: Given a user has a non-published route that includes a start location
When the user removes its current start location
Then the route should be updated to start at the first scheduled stop
And the ETAs are recalculated
And no stops are removed from the route

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Update route start or end time

column2: Given a user has a non-published route
When the user updates the route start time
Then the route should be updated with the new start time
And the stop ETAs are recalculated
And no stops are removed from the route

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Update vehicle capacity

column2: Given a user has a non-published route
When the user updates the vehicle capacity
Then the route capacity should be updated
And the route capacity utilization should be updated
And no stops are removed from the route

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Cannot update route constraints for published routes

When the user attempts to update the route constraints
Then the user should be blocked

column1: 828282,"User can schedule a new order to an existing route and respect optimization preferences","No","","2024-11-01T20:23:25.388Z","Teja Vajha","","","","Modifying Routes","","ROUT-12752","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can schedule an order to a route and respect flexible start time preference

858118,"User can reverse routes","No","","2024-11-26T19:25:41.998Z","Will Wearing","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Attempt to reverse a published route

column2: Given a route is already published
When the user opens the route panel for the route
Then the reverse action button is disabled

column1: Scenario: Reverse an unpublished route

column2: Given a route is NOT published
When the user reverses the route
Then they are returned a route which has the stops organized in the opposite sequence (time windows are violated if necessary)
And the stop ETAs are updated based on the new sequence

column1: Scenario: Get UI warning of time window violation upon reversing a route

column2: Given the user reverses a route
When they get back the reversed route
Then the any stop in the new sequence for which the time window was violated has the violation UI affordace

column1: Scenario: Get UI indication of waiting time upon reversing a route

column2: Given the user reverses a route
When they get back the reversed route
Then the any stop that has a waiting time in the new sequence  has the wait time UI affordace

column1: Scenario: Reverse a route with Avoid Ferry setting turned ON

column3: Given the Avoid Ferry setting is turned ON
And the user reverses a route
Then the reversed route should also avoid ferry

column1: Scenario: Reverse a route with Avoid Toll Road setting turned ON

column3: Given the Avoid Toll Road setting is turned ON
And the user reverses a route
Then the reversed route should also avoid toll roads

column1: Scenario: Undo a reverse route action

column3: Given the user has already reversed a route
And then chose to undo it
Then they get back the orginal route with all the pre-existing ETAs and violation affordances

column1: Scenario: Redo a reverse route action

column3: Given the user has already undone reversed a route
And then chose to redo it

Then they get back the reversed sequence of route with all the pre-existing ETAs and violation affordances","","","Modifying Routes","","","","Normal","","Draft","Skipped","2025-10-30T17:36:08.553Z","","","","Case (text)","2024-11-26T19:27:39.535Z","Will Wearing"

column1: 995295,"User can move stops within a route","No","","2025-02-07T19:52:08.763Z","Jenya Farris","","","","Modifying Routes","","","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can move stop to another position in in the same route
Given a stop is not the current stop
When a dispatcher drags the stop via the RDP to another position
Then the stop sequence is updated
And the ETAs for each stop and order are updated
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Dispatcher can't move stop with re-attempt within route

column2: Given a stop contains the re-attempt for an order
When the dispatcher moves that stop within the route
Then the move is rejected And the user is given appropiate feedback","Draft","Skipped","2025-10-30T17:36:12.237Z","","","","BDD Feature","2025-02-28T20:37:01.210Z","Jamil"

column1: 995296,"User can move stops to another route","No","","2025-02-07T19:52:21.817Z","Jenya Farris","","","","Modifying Routes","","","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can move stop to a different route
Given a stop is not the current stop
When a dispatcher moves the stop to a different route
Then the stop is rescheduled to the target route
And the ETAs and polylines for both the routes are updated
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Dispatcher can't move stop with re-attempt to another route

column2: Given a stop contains the re-attempt for an order
When the dispatcher moves that stop to a different route
Then the move is rejected And the user is given appropiate feedback","Draft","Skipped","2025-10-30T17:36:19.043Z","","","","BDD Feature","2025-02-28T20:39:18.065Z","Jamil"

column1: 995297,"User can unschedule a stop from a route","No","","2025-02-07T19:52:49.586Z","Jenya Farris","","","","Modifying Routes","","","","Normal","","Draft","Passed","2025-07-15T23:03:02.955Z","","","","BDD Feature","",""

983011,"User can change the route sequence by drawing their preferred route on map","No","","2025-02-01T00:08:17.326Z","Serena Tay","","","","Modifying Routes","","","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can change the route sequence by drawing their preferred route on map

column2: Given that user has an existing optimized route
When the user edits the route through the draw route feature
Then routific will generate a route that matches as closely as possible to the pattern drawn by the user

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Draw route feature can violate time window constraints

column2: Given that user has an existing optimized route respecting time windows on the orders
When the user edits the route through draw route feature in a manner that violates time windows on the orders
Then routific should generate a route respecting user's drawn pattern by violating time window constraints if needed

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Draw route feature can violate shift end constraint

column2: Given that user has an existing optimized route respecting shift time constraints
When the user edits the route through draw route feature in a manner that violates the specified shift duration
Then routific should generate a route respecting user's drawn pattern by violating shift end time if needed

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Draw route feature can violate capacity constraints

column2: Given that user has an existing optimized route respecting capacity constraints
When the user adds additional orders to the route that pushes the route to become overcapacitated
And when the user edits the route through draw route feature

Then routific should generate a route respecting user's drawn pattern even though the capacity constraint on the route is violated","Draft","Skipped","2025-10-30T17:36:22.660Z","","","","BDD Feature","2025-02-01T00:12:11.651Z","Serena Tay"

87,"User can delete a route with scheduled stops","No","","2024-01-31T03:06:05.031Z","Andrew Kwok","","","","Deleting Routes","","","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: unscheduling order/s with delivery date in the past

1009627,"User can see list of drivers ordered by familiarity","No","","2025-02-14T20:21:11.777Z","Rodrigo Boos","","","","Assigning Drivers","","","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Existing organization is opted into driver familiarity feature
Given the organization has previously executed routes within their workspace
And that the organization is opted into driver familiarity feature
When the dispatcher optimizes a new set of routes
And clicks on assign driver to route affordance
Then the dispatcher should see a sorted list of drivers based on their familiarity of the route
Scenario: New Organization is opted into driver familiarity feature
Given the organization does not have any previous executed routes within their workspace
And that the organization is opted into driver familiarity feature
When the dispatcher optimizes a new set of routes
And clicks on assign driver to a route affordance
Then the dispatcher should see a list of drivers sorted alphabetically
Scenario: Familiarity service is unavailable
Given the organization has previously executed routes within their workspace
And that the organization is opted into the driver familiarity feature
And that the familiarity service is temporarily unavailable
When the dispatcher optimizes a new set of routes
And clicks on assign driver to a route affordance
Then the dispatcher should see a list of drivers displayed in alphabetical order
Scenario: Any Organization not opted into driver familiarity feature
Given the organization has previously executed routes within their workspace
And that the organization is not opted into driver familiarity feature
When the dispatcher optimizes a new set of routes
And clicks on assign driver to a route affordance
Then the dispatcher should see a list of drivers sorted alphabetically

column1: 129,"Delivery scheduled notifications are sent when publishing a route","No","","2024-01-31T03:06:05.097Z","Andrew Kwok","","","","Delivery Scheduled Notification","","","","Normal","","Draft","Skipped","2025-08-06T17:13:54.940Z","","","","Case (text)","",""

130,"Delivery scheduled notifications can be disabled","No","","2024-01-31T03:06:05.099Z","Andrew Kwok","","","","Delivery Scheduled Notification","","","","Normal","","Draft","Passed","2025-07-14T20:41:38.240Z","","","","Case (text)","",""
131,"Delivery scheduled notifications are sent when republishing a route","No","","2024-01-31T03:06:05.100Z","Andrew Kwok","<ol>
• Create a route with a time window in the future that includes email and/or phone numbers.
• Dispatch this new route.
• Add a new order to the previously published route
• Perform a change to the route that requires republishing it.
• Re-publishes your changes
• Publishing summary count filters out orders whose ETA is in the past.
• The new order will fire a notification.
• No repeated notification is sent after re-publishing a previously dispatched route.
","Delivery Scheduled Notification","","","","Normal","","Draft","Passed","2025-07-14T20:45:22.510Z","","","","Case (text)","",""
132,"Delivery scheduled notifications are not sent for orders scheduled in the past","No","","2024-01-31T03:06:05.105Z","Andrew Kwok","<ol>
• Create a route with a time window in the past that includes email and/or phone numbers.
• Dispatch this new route.
• Publishing summary count filters out orders whose ETA is in the past.
• Notifications are still fired to all orders whose ETA is ahead.
","Delivery Scheduled Notification","","","","Normal","","Draft","Passed","2025-07-14T20:42:19.913Z","","","","Case (text)","",""
133,"Delivery scheduled notifications can contain dynamic template variables","No","","2024-01-31T03:06:05.109Z","Andrew Kwok","<ol>
• Create a route with some orders that require notifications to be sent for the next day between 09:00 and 17:00.
• Set the ‘Delivery Scheduled’ Delivery window to 60 minutes.
• Dispatch this new route.
• The delivery window for any order whose delivery window exceeds the route shift (in this case, 09:00-17:00) is overridden.

For example, for order A, the ETA is 09:30. In this example, with a +/-60 minute delivery window, the interval would be 08:30-10:30. However, this interval violates the route shift, so the delivery window is adjusted to 09:00-10:30.
The same happens for any order at the end of the shift. If the order’s expected ETA is set at 16:30, the resulting time window will be 15:30-17:00.
• For orders whose delivery window does not violate the route shift, the Delivery window is adjusted solely based on the ‘Delivery window’ set by the dispatcher.
• Tags (stop_name, notes, date, eta_window and organization_name) are correctly replaced by actual values.
","Delivery Scheduled Notification","","","","Normal","","Draft","Skipped","2025-07-14T20:45:48.602Z","","","","Case (text)","",""

134,"Scheduled delivery time window cannot be earlier than scheduled route start time","No","","2024-01-31T03:06:05.114Z","Andrew Kwok","

Publish route

","","

In the delivery scheduled notification, the delivery window in the notification should read 9:00am to 10:30am (given a 9:30am and a +/-60 minute leeway)

//This is because the route is only scheduled to be started at 9:00am so we don't reasonably expect it to be delivered earlier than that.

","Delivery Scheduled Notification","","","","Normal","","Draft","Passed","2025-07-14T20:45:55.896Z","","","","Case (text)","",""

136,"Driver on the way notifications can be disabled","No","","2024-01-31T03:06:05.120Z","Andrew Kwok","","","","Driver on the Way Notification","","","","Normal","","Draft","Passed","2025-07-14T20:48:07.228Z","","","","Case (text)","",""
137,"Driver on the way notification timing should be updated as route timings change","No","","2024-01-31T03:06:05.121Z","Andrew Kwok","<ol>
• Create a route with three or more stops for a future time window that require DoW notifications to be sent.
• As a dispatcher, publish this new route to a driver.
• As a driver, start the route.
• As a driver, complete the first two stops.

","","

At every interaction, and the ETA is updated, the notification time for each pending stop on the route is updated based on the most recent ETA value.

","Driver on the Way Notification","","","","Normal","","Draft","Passed","2025-07-14T20:48:30.214Z","","","","Case (text)","",""
138,"Driver on the way notifications should not be sent for unscheduled orders","No","","2024-01-31T03:06:05.126Z","Andrew Kwok","<ol>
• Create a route with three or more stops for a future time window that require DoW notifications to be sent.
• As a dispatcher, publish this new route to a driver.
• As a driver, start the route.
• As a dispatcher, unschedule an order from the route and re-publish the changes for an stop whose DoW hasn’t been fired yet.
• The previously scheduled DoW notification for the unscheduled order is cancelled.
• The scheduled notification time for other orders is updated accordingly.
","Driver on the Way Notification","","","","Normal","","Draft","Failed","2025-07-14T20:54:20.017Z","","","","Case (text)","",""
139,"Driver on the way notifications can contain dynamic template variables","No","","2024-01-31T03:06:05.130Z","Andrew Kwok","<ol>
• Create a route with some orders that require notifications to be sent for the next day between 09:00 and 17:00.
• Set the ‘Driver on the Way’ Delivery window to 60 minutes.
• As a Dispatcher, publish this new route.
• As a driver, start the route.

","","

As the notifications are fired, the tags (stop_name, notes, minutes_away and organization_name) are correctly replaced by actual values in the resulting notification.

","Driver on the Way Notification","","","","Normal","","Draft","Skipped","2025-07-14T20:48:45.751Z","","","","Case (text)","",""
140,"Driver on the way notifications are not sent after a delivery completed notification is sent","No","","2024-01-31T03:06:05.135Z","Andrew Kwok","<ol>
• Create a route that includes orders with valid phone numbers.
• As a dispatcher, publish this new route to a driver.
• As a driver, start the route.
• As a driver, complete an order whose DoW notification hasn’t been fired yet (ETA > 30 minutes ahead)
• Delivered notification is fired when the completed order contains a valid email address or phone number.
• ETAs are updated based on the updated route.
• The scheduled Driver on the Way notification associated to the delivered order must be updated to cancelled.
","Driver on the Way Notification","","","","Normal","","Draft","Passed","2025-07-14T20:48:54.528Z","","","","Case (text)","",""
141,"Driver on the way notifications are not sent after a delivery missed notification is sent","No","","2024-01-31T03:06:05.139Z","Andrew Kwok","<ol>
• Create a route that includes orders with valid phone numbers.
• As a dispatcher, publish this new route to a driver.
• As a driver, start the route.
• As a driver, miss an order whose DoW notification hasn’t been fired yet (ETA > 30 minutes ahead)
• Missed notification is fired when the completed order contains a valid email address or phone number.
• ETAs are updated based on the updated route.
• The scheduled Driver on the Way notification associated to the delivered order must be updated to cancelled.
","Driver on the Way Notification","","","","Normal","","Draft","Passed","2025-07-14T20:49:08.942Z","","","","Case (text)","",""

909309,"User can optimize routes with time of day predicted traffic","No","","2024-12-16T18:32:43.938Z","Rodrigo Boos","","","","Workspace Management","","","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: ""Schedule All"" assigns unserved orders to existing routes
Given there are unserved orders in the ""unscheduled orders"" tray
And existing routes are available for scheduling
When the user triggers ""Schedule All""
Then the system schedules the unserved orders into the existing routes
And the routes' schedules are updated to reflect the newly assigned orders
And the ""unscheduled orders"" tray is updated to remove the scheduled orders
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Reoptimizing routes
Given routes have assigned stops and orders
And the user requests to reoptimize the routes
When the system reoptimizes the routes
Then we recalculate the stop sequence for all routes
And the routes are updated to reflect the optimized schedules
And the system ensures improved efficiency of the routes
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Moving stops triggers compute-schedule on the route losing stops, and best-insert on the route adding stops
Given Route A has assigned stops
And stops need to be moved to Route B
When the stops are moved from Route A to Route B
Then the system triggers compute-schedule for Route A and best-insert for Route B
And Route B reflects the newly assigned stops
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Unscheduling an order removes it from the route
Given Route A has orders assigned
And an order is scheduled for removal
When the order is unscheduled from Route A
Then the system removes the order from Route A
And the system updates the route schedule
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Moving an order updates the route sequence
Given Route A has multiple stops with orders
And an order needs to change its position in the route
When the order is moved to a new position within Route A
Then the system updates the sequence of stops in Route A
And the updated route schedule is returned
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Reversing a route updates the stop order
Given Route A has stops in a specific sequence
And the user requests to reverse the route
When the system reverses the route
Then the stops in Route A appear in reverse order
And the system updates the schedule to reflect the reversed sequence","Draft","Passed","2025-07-14T20:55:27.578Z","","","","BDD Feature","2024-12-17T20:53:55.959Z","Teja Vajha"

12241,"User can create an organization","No","","2024-02-13T02:50:03.895Z","Andrew Kwok","","","","Organization Management","","ROUT-9090,ROUT-9227,ROUT-9228","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Creating a New Company
Given the user is on the signup page
When the user enters valid company creation details
And completes the user creation step
Then a new company should be created
And a Stripe customer should be created for the company
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Require Company Name
Given the user is on the signup page
And has not entered a company name
When the user tries to proceed
Then the user should be blocked from proceeding
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Preventing Organization Creation with Name Containing Weblink
Given the user is on the organization creation page
When the user enters ""<organizationName>"" as the organization name
And attempts to create the organization
Then the creation should be rejected
And a message indicating invalid organization name should be displayed
Examples:
| organizationName                 |
| MyCompany http://mywebsite.com   |
| ExampleOrg www.example.org       |
| TechCo https://tech.example.net  |
| BusinessInc ftp://files.business |
| Store1234 www.store.shop         |
| Store1234 store.shop |
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Rejecting Company Names with Non-Visible Characters Forming a URL
Given the user is on the company creation form
When the user enters a ""<company name>"" with non-visible characters mimicking a URL format
Then the system should identify the company name as invalid
And the form cannot be submitted
And message indicating invalid organization name should be d displayed
Examples:
| badlink.­com | //Copy paste this example, it has a non printable character in it
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Company website is optional

column2: Given the user is on the signup page
And has not provided a company website
When the user tries to proceed
Then they should not be blocked

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Preventing Company Creation with Invalid Website URL
Given the user is on the company creation page
When the user enters ""<invalidURL>"" as the website URL
And attempts to create the company
Then the form cannot be submitted
And user is instructed to enter a valid URL
Examples:
| invalidURL           |
| http://invalid.tld   |
| www.nosuchdomain.xyz |
| http://.com          |
| ftp://invalid.com    |
| justtextwithoutdot |
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Tracking Company Created Event

column2: Given a user is in the company creation flow
When the user succesfully creates a company
Then a 'Company Created' event should be tracked
And a company profile should be created with the relevant company information

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Editing company name as admin
Given the user is on the company settings page
And the user has admin permissions
When the user updates the company name to ""New name""
Then the change should be saved
And a success message should be shown
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Company name edit triggers analytics event
Given the user successfully updates the company name
Then a ""Company name updated"" analytics event should be fired
And it should include previous and new values
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Dispatcher and read only users cannot edit company name
Given the user does not have admin permissions
Then the company name input should be read-only","Draft","Passed","2025-07-17T20:50:43.737Z","","","","BDD Feature","2025-07-17T15:21:10.804Z","Will Wearing"

151573,"Send Invite","No","","2024-04-16T16:03:42.935Z","Peter Kemp","","","","Managing Teammates","","","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Invite users to an org
Given a user is an admin in an org
When they invite a teammate with one or more roles
Then an invite is created with those roles
And an invite email is sent if if the user does not yet have a Routific account
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Dispatchers cannot invite drivers
Given a user is a dispatcher but not an admin in an org
When the dispatcher attempts to invite a driver
Then the action is blocked
And the dispatcher sees feedback to ask their admin for invite privileges
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Invite teammate with optional Name in the member invite

column2: Given the user has necessary permisson to invite teammates
And includes a Name in the invite
And assigned an available role
When user sends the teammate invitation
Then the invite email received by the employee is personalized using the provided name

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Block invite if teammate already exists.

column2: Given the user has necessary permisson to invite teammates
And inputs the email of an existing teammate.
When user submits the invite
Then they are blocked and given feedback that the teammate already exists in the org

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Revoke a pending invite
Given an invite is pending
And the user has an admin role
When they revoke the invite
Then the invite is marked revoked
And the invite cannot be accepted
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Invites expire after 30 days
Given an invite is pending
When 30 days pass from the creation of the invite
Then the invite is marked expired
And the invite cannot be accepted","Draft","Passed","2025-12-19T21:21:32.149Z","","","","BDD Feature","2026-01-08T00:10:58.152Z","Marc"

151574,"Accept Invite","No","","2024-04-16T16:06:10.219Z","Peter Kemp","","","","Managing Teammates","","ROUT-8692","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Successful attempt using email & password

column2: Given the invited user followed a valid invite link
And input a name, valid email and acceptable password
When they submit the form
Then a routific account is created using the name, email
And the user added to the org that sent the invite
And the user is assigned the role specified in the invite
And the pending status for the corresponding invite is updated in the invite table

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Successful attempt using Google SSO

column2: Given the invited user followed a valid invite link
And chose to continue with Google
When they successfully authenticate with Google SSO
Then a routific account is created using the name and email returned by Google
And the user added to the org that sent the invite
And the user is assigned the role specified in the invite
And the pending status for the corresponding invite is updated in the invite table

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Successful attempt using Apple SSO

column2: Given the invited user followed a valid invite link
And chose to continue with Apple
When they successfully authenticate with Apple account
Then a routific account is created using the name and email returned by Apple
And the user added to the org that sent the invite
And the user is assigned the role specified in the invite
And the pending status for the corresponding invite is updated in the invite table

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Unsuccessful attempt for existing accounts

column2: Given the invited user followed a valid invite link
And uses an email that already has an existing routific account
When they try to sign up and accept invite
Then they are blocked and shown feedeback that the account already exists

column1: <pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Unsuccessful attempt using an already used invite link

column2: Given the corresponding invite has already been accepted
When the user opens an used invite link
Then they can not use the link to accept the invite
And are shown feedback that invite is no longer valid","Draft","Passed","2025-12-19T21:25:42.448Z","","","","BDD Feature","2024-04-16T16:13:51.950Z","Peter Kemp"

column1: 1794135,"Invite existing users to an organization","No","","2026-01-07T23:53:01.239Z","Marc","","","","Managing Teammates","","","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Admin invites an existing user to their organization
Given a user is an admin in an org
And there is an existing Routific user with a different org
When the admin invites that user by email with one or more roles
Then an invite is created with those roles
And no invite email is sent to the user
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Admin cannot invite a user already in their organization
Given a user is an admin in an org
And there is a user who is already a member of that org
When the admin attempts to invite that user by email
Then the invite is rejected
And an error message indicates the user is already a member
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Admin cannot invite a deleted user
Given a user is an admin in an org
And there is a deleted user account
When the admin attempts to invite that deleted user by email
Then the invite is rejected
And an error message indicates the user cannot be invited
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Existing user sees pending invite on web app account settings
Given an existing user has a pending invite to join another org
And the user logs in
Then they see an notification about a pending invite
And when the user navigates to account settings on the web app
Then they see the pending invite with org details and assigned roles
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Existing driver sees pending invite on mobile app
Given an existing driver user has a pending invite to join another org
When the driver views the company page on the mobile app
Then they see the pending invite with org details
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Existing user accepts invite and is moved to new org
Given an existing user has a pending invite to join another org
When the user accepts the invite
Then the user is moved to the inviting org
And the user's roles are replaced with the invited roles
And the user is disconnected from any prior driver profiles
And an audit trail entry is created
And the user is logged out
When the user logs back in
Then the user will be in the new org
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User with pending invite can sign up without using invite link
Given a pending invite exists for an email address
And no Routific account exists for that email
When someone signs up with that email without using the invite link
Then the sign-up is allowed
And a new account is created
And the pending invite remains available for them to accept later","Draft","Passed","2026-01-15T01:47:40.223Z","","","","BDD Feature","2026-01-07T23:56:55.392Z","Marc"

1794136,"Invite existing drivers using the unified user invite flow","No","","2026-01-08T00:13:29.546Z","Marc","","","","Managing Teammates","","","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Admin invites an existing driver from another org with driver role
Given a user is an admin in an org
And there is an existing driver in a different org
When the admin invites that driver by email with the driver role
Then an invite is created with the driver role
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Existing driver sees pending invite on mobile app company page
Given an existing driver has a pending invite to join another org
When the driver views the company page on the mobile app
Then they see the pending invite with org details and assigned roles
When the driver accepts the invite
Then the driver is moved to the inviting org
And a new driver profile is created for the inviting org
And the driver is disconnected from their prior driver profile
And the driver no longer has access to routes from the previous org","Draft","","","","","","BDD Feature","2026-01-08T00:20:21.118Z","Marc"

• Map Popover, ETA & ETD
• Map Popover, order time window
• Route Details Panel -> Stop Card, ETA & ETD
• Route Details Panel -> Stop Card, order time window
• Order Details Panel -> time window
• Orders Table, time window
• Calendar -> Week View -> Route Card, shift start & end time
• Add Route from Template Screen, list route start & end time
• Add Route from Template Screen, checkout route start & end time
• CSV download, Time window start & end, Arrive at, Start at, Finish by, Completion/skipped time
User can also view/edit times using a 24hr format in the following places:
<ul>
• Add Order Form, time window
• Edit Order Form, time window
• Add Route Form, shift start & end time
• Edit Route Form, shift start & end time
• Workspace Settings > Route Settings > Templates, Shift time
• Bulk edit order form, edit time window

143366,"Optimization is blocked after user usage limit is exceeded","No","","2024-04-09T20:05:32.042Z","Julio Renner","","","","Optimizing Routes (/optimize endpoint)","","","","Normal","

Trigger a request to the /optimize/create endpoint, you may use the attached payload.

 

The request should succeed (considering the user usage is untouched)

Trigger a follow-up request with a different set of stops. The previous payload had 100 stops, therefore, the second payload should exceed the user usage limits.

The request should fail with a usage limit error and status code 403.

Be aware that updating usage limits is an async and not guaranteed operation, therefore, you may face some flakiness. You may try to do some additional requests and also check user usage if the tests fail.

","Draft","Skipped","2025-07-15T17:22:53.490Z","","","","BDD Feature","2024-04-09T20:15:26.412Z","Julio Renner"

933880,"Optimization read don't show routeSchedule if rate limiter is reached","No","","2024-12-20T00:09:54.867Z","Rodrigo Boos","","","","Optimizing Routes (/optimize endpoint)","","","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Rate limiter blocks a request when exceeding the limit
Given the RateLimiter service is configured with a limit of 4 requests per 60 seconds
And the user has made 4 requests for the same action_uuid in the last 60 seconds
When the user makes another GET /optimize API call with the action_uuid
Then the RateLimiter service increments the count for the action_uuid
And the RateLimiter response indicates the request is not allowed
And the API returns a 429 Too Many Requests error

And the error response body includes a message like: { ""msg"": ""Failed to poll for {action_uuid} solution, the limit of requests per minute was reached. You could try again in X seconds."" }","Draft","Failed","2025-07-15T18:35:25.957Z","","","","BDD Feature","2024-12-20T01:17:50.295Z","Andrew Kwok"

12267,"User can add orders to a specific workspace","No","","2024-02-13T17:36:51.508Z","Teja Vajha","","","","Orders","","","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User can add orders to a workspace using a API-user token

column2: Given a user has access to an API token with only an API-user role associated with it

column1: 201,"Routicians can generate non expiring access token for a service account","No","","2024-01-31T03:06:05.287Z","Andrew Kwok","<ol>
• Call the planning-service endpoint in path /user/api/add using the ROUTICIAN access token and the following request body:
description"": ""Token Usage Description"",
organizationEmail"": ""<VALID EXISTENT EMAIL>"",
userName"": ""x-men-optimization-user""

}

","","

Step 1 validation:
The response should contain the following values:
<ol>
• Description: Describing what the token is going to be used for.
• OrganizationID: Organization for which the token was generated.
• ID: JWT Token ID
• Type: The type of token generated. Should be 'api'.
• User: Contains the user ID generated and the user name. The user name should match what was provided in the input body (""x-men-optimization-user"").
• AccessToken: JWT Token generated, which should be used for the API requests by the user.
The JWT Token payload (you can see it in https://jwt.io/) should:
<ol>
• Have the field ""jti"" matching the value from the field ""ID"" from the response body.
• Have the field ""orgId"" matching the value from the field ""organizationID"" from the response body.
• Have the field ""userId"" matching the value from the field ""user.id"" from the response body.
• Have the field ""type"" matching the value from the field ""type"" from the response body.
• NOT have the field ""exp"".

And that they are on a free trial
And that they have unlimited orders
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: A user can view scheduled order usage
When a new company is downgraded to the free plan
Then a user can see the current billing cycle date range of 1 month
And how many orders have been scheduled across their company in the current billing cycle
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Free plan billing cycle renews monthly
Given a user is on a free plan
When a user views the billing page after the end of a billing cycle
Then they should see a new billing cycle which starts at the end of the last cycle and ends a month later
And a count of only the orders scheduled in the new billing cycle
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Paid plan billing cycle is in sync with Stripe
Given a user is on a paid plan
And that plan was not cancelled at the time of cycle renewal
When a user views the billing page after the end of a billing cycle
Then they should see a new billing cycle with a date range of that matches their Stripe subscription's cycle
And a count of only the orders scheduled in the new billing cycle
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Billing cycle renews at end of short months
Given a user has a billing cycle which ends on a late day of a month (i.e. Aug 31)
When the billing cycle renews on a shorter month (i.e. Sept)
Then then the end date of that billing cycle is set to the last day of that month (i.e. Sept 30)
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: View usage count of past billing cycles
Given a billing cycle with an end date in the past
When an engineer looks up that billing cycle via the DB
Then they can see how many orders were billed to it","Draft","Passed","2025-12-18T01:06:15.107Z","","","","BDD Feature","2024-11-12T20:50:06.707Z","Will Wearing"

55291,"User can upgrade plan","No","","2024-02-21T21:30:48.013Z","Jenya Farris","","","","Billing","","ROUT-9093,ROUT-9104,ROUT-9805","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Free user can upgrade to Growth plan

<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Abandoning upgrade process does not change plan

<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Subscription created event is tracked

<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Plan name of a user is shared with analytics tools

And in Mixpanel","Active","Passed","2025-12-18T14:32:48.409Z","","","","BDD Feature","2024-03-26T00:36:41.920Z","Andrew Kwok"

102398,"User can contact support","No","","2024-03-14T22:01:34.585Z","Andrew Kwok","","","","Support","","ROUT-9173","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Anonymous user requests help via the help button
Given the user is unauthenticated
And   is on the login or signup page
When  the user presses the help button
Then  the Gleap widget should appear
And   the user can send a message
And the message should be visible to the support team in Gleap
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Anonymous user requests help after a login error
Given the user is unauthenticated
When  the user attempts to login with invalid credentials
And   the user receives an error with an option to contact support
And   the user clicks the 'contact support' option
Then  the Gleap widget should appear
And   the user can send a message
And the message should be visible to the support team in Gleap
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Authenticated user requests help
Given the user is authenticated
When  the user clicks the 'contact support' option
Then  the Gleap widget should appear
And   the user can view previous messages
And   the user can send a new message
And   the new message should be visible to the support team in Gleap and associated with the current user
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: Chat information is not available after user logout
Given the user is authenticated and has sent messages via the Gleap widget
When  the user logs out
Then the user's chat information should not be available or visible
<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: User does not see any messages after logging out and identity reset

column1: 740246,"View insights for a date range","No","","2024-10-15T23:26:33.417Z","Isaac Ribeiro","","","","View Insights","","","","Normal","<pre><code class=""editor-gherkin language-gherkin code-block"">Scenario: View insights for the default/fallback date range
